page.title: 09Farming, and Animals.
page.content: Farming on the rather poor soil of this area is quite varied and must depend on the degree of cultivation and fertilisation. Much is grassland or even rough grazing given over to horses. Farms or holdings are small. Several herds of cattle but few heifers and milking cows are noted, also two flocks of sheep, one very small. Near Liphook wheat and oats were harvested. In one of the other few arable fields, the crop was potatoes. From the highest ground in the NE, an apple orchard on SW slope continues to prosper, 'Cox' being one of the varieties grown. The majority of households own a dog. A kennels and cattery advertises boarding facilities, shampooing, etc.. Roe deer traverse the area eating choice shoots in gardens. Rabbits threaten to increase.
